name: part_006
file: tmp_【3D重大告知】VTuber人生を教科書にして #しくじりかなたそ 先生爆誕！！【天音かなた⧸ホロライブ】 [fm9yOM9knZo]_gemini-3-flash-preview/reencoded/part_006.mov

scenes.description: Kanata talks about the support she received from her listeners during her period of voice loss.
The members discuss how much warm comments from listeners mean to them, with Ririka sharing her perspective.
Lamy shares her experience of being supported by her fans, the 'Yukimin', during a health-related break.
Okayu shares how listeners are kind to her even when she cries or gets sniffly during emotional gaming moments.
Kanata talks about the support from fellow Hololive members, specifically Shiranui Flare and her gen-mate Kiryu Coco.
Kanata discusses the significant impact of her close friend and gen-mate Kiryu Coco's graduation.
The members discuss the 'legend' of Kiryu Coco, mentioning her innovative content like AsaCoco and her impact on the group.
Kanata recounts her decision to create a 4th Gen original song herself after being told by management that there wasn't enough time.

subtitles.original: リスナーさんから
subtitles.english: From listeners,

subtitles.original: 「それでも歌大好きだよ」って言ってもらえて
subtitles.english: being told "I still love your singing,"

subtitles.original: 「あ、まだやってもいいのかな」とか思えましたし
subtitles.english: it made me think, "Oh, maybe I can keep going,"

subtitles.original: そういう風に、今絶対聞き苦しいのに
subtitles.english: and truly, even though it must be

subtitles.original: 聴いてくれるみんなのために頑張りたいと
subtitles.english: hard to hear right now, I wanted to do

subtitles.original: 思いましたね、心から。
subtitles.english: my best for everyone who listens.

subtitles.original: リスナーさんからの温かい言葉ってさ、心に残るし嬉しいよね。
subtitles.english: Warm words from listeners really stay in your heart and make you happy, don't they?

subtitles.original: 嬉しい。ね。そうだよね。
subtitles.english: They do. Yeah, they really do.

subtitles.original: みんなあるよね、そういうことね。
subtitles.english: Everyone has those moments.

subtitles.original: めっちゃあります。
subtitles.english: Absolutely.

subtitles.original: ちょっと落ち込んだ時とかにエゴサして「今日も可愛かったな」とか
subtitles.english: When I'm feeling a bit down, I'll search for myself and see comments like "She was cute today too" or

subtitles.original: 「いっぱい頑張ってるね」とか
subtitles.english: "She's working so hard," and

subtitles.original: そういう優しいコメント見るだけで胸がいっぱいになって
subtitles.english: just seeing those kind comments fills my heart,

subtitles.original: 「また頑張ろう」って気持ちにマジでなれます。
subtitles.english: and I truly feel like I can give it my all again.

subtitles.original: ありがとう！
subtitles.english: Thank you!

subtitles.original: 素敵だね。
subtitles.english: That's wonderful.

subtitles.original: ラミィも、自分の体調の悪化で配信がしばらくできなかった時期があるんだけど
subtitles.english: I also had a period where I couldn't stream for a while due to my health worsening,

subtitles.original: その間にリスナーさんがずっと「ラミィちゃんいつまでも待ってるからね」って
subtitles.english: and during that time, listeners were constantly saying, "Lamy-chan, we'll wait for you forever" or

subtitles.original: 「体調よく治すように、ちゃんと今休むんだよ」って
subtitles.english: "Make sure you rest well to recover,"

subtitles.original: ずっと待っててくれて、実際復帰した時もみんな温かく
subtitles.english: They waited for me the whole time, and when I actually came back, everyone was so warm,

subtitles.original: 「ラミィちゃん待ってたよ、良かったね」って出迎えてくれて
subtitles.english: welcoming me back with "Lamy-chan, we've been waiting for you, glad you're back!"

subtitles.original: リスナーさん、あの時はありがとう。雪民さんいつも大好きだよ。
subtitles.english: Listeners, thank you for that time. Yukimin, I always love you.

subtitles.original: おかゆ先輩もありますか？
subtitles.english: How about you, Okayu-senpai?

subtitles.original: おかゆ先輩は体調崩したこととかはないけど
subtitles.english: I haven't really had health issues like that, but

subtitles.original: やっぱりこうゲームやっててめっちゃ悲しいシーンが来て
subtitles.english: when I'm playing a game and a really

subtitles.original: エンエン泣いちゃったりして鼻ずっぴずぴになったりするんだけど
subtitles.english: sad scene comes up, I'll end up crying my eyes out and my nose gets all sniffly,

subtitles.original: 「ゆっくりでいいよ」「ゆっくり鼻かんでいいよ」って
subtitles.english: but they tell me "Take your time" or "It's okay to blow your nose,"

subtitles.original: 言ってくれる優しさを感じますね、いつも本当に。
subtitles.english: I always feel their kindness, really.

subtitles.original: ありがとね。
subtitles.english: Thank you.

subtitles.original: 優しいね。
subtitles.english: They're so kind.

subtitles.original: あとはたくさんホロメンにも応援してもらって
subtitles.english: And I also got a lot of support from other Hololive members,

subtitles.original: 例えばフレア先輩から「耳の病気とかハンデがあっても、
subtitles.english: for example, Flare-senpai told me, "Even with

subtitles.original: その上でも歌上手だからすごいよ！」って言ってもらったりして勇気づけられたりとか
subtitles.english: your ear condition or any handicap, your singing is amazing!" which really encouraged me.

subtitles.original: あとは同期の桐生ココというね、人がいたんですけれども、まあ今卒業してしまいましたが
subtitles.english: Also, there was my gen-mate, Kiryu Coco... she's graduated now, but

subtitles.original: 当時一緒の家で同居していたので、僕が落ち込んでいる時、特に何か言うわけでもなく
subtitles.english: we were living together at the time, so when I was feeling down, she wouldn't necessarily say anything special,

subtitles.original: 「あ、飯食う？」みたいな感じで
subtitles.english: but she'd just be like, "Oh, wanna eat?"

subtitles.original: ちょっと似てる。
subtitles.english: That's a bit of an impression.

subtitles.original: 「飯食う？」みたいな感じで、一緒に何かの味噌汁食べたりとか
subtitles.english: Like "Wanna eat?", we'd eat miso soup together or

subtitles.original: 午前3時にちょっとおやつ食べたりとか
subtitles.english: have a snack at 3 AM...

subtitles.original: そういうのができたのが、今思うとすごく助かりました。
subtitles.english: Looking back, being able to do things like that was a huge help.

subtitles.original: そんな時に大事件が起きます。
subtitles.english: And then, a major incident occurs.

subtitles.original: 同期メンバーの「卒業」です。
subtitles.english: The "graduation" of a gen-mate.

subtitles.original: これはですね、4期生は元々、今は4人なんですけど5人おりまして
subtitles.english: You see, Gen 4 originally had five members, though there are four of us now,

subtitles.original: 同期のもう本当に天才のように面白かった桐生ココがですね、卒業することになりました。
subtitles.english: and my gen-mate Kiryu Coco, who was truly a genius-level comedian, was to graduate.

subtitles.original: 何より同居とかしてたりとか、生活を共にしたりっていうのもあって、色んな話も聞いていたし
subtitles.english: More than anything, since we lived together and shared our daily lives, I'd heard many things from her,

subtitles.original: 仲もね、本当に一番良かったかなと思います。
subtitles.english: and I think our bond was truly the strongest.

subtitles.original: その時に、活動の先に求めるものとか、生活の感じとかも色々似ていて
subtitles.english: At the time, what we sought beyond our activities and our lifestyles were very similar,

subtitles.original: 本当に気が合った。
subtitles.english: we really clicked.

subtitles.original: そんなココの卒業っていうのは、僕にとってもかなり大きい出来事でございました。
subtitles.english: So Coco's graduation was an incredibly significant event for me as well.

subtitles.original: で、ね、リリカは喋ったことないもんね。
subtitles.english: And, well, Ririka, you've never spoken with her, right?

subtitles.original: そうですね、リリカが入った時にはすでにご卒業されてたんですけど
subtitles.english: That's right. She had already graduated by the time I joined,

subtitles.original: 伝説のドラゴンのイメージが本当にもうすごくて、「最強の人」っていうイメージがあります。
subtitles.english: but the image of the "Legendary Dragon" is so strong; I see her as the "strongest person."

subtitles.original: いや、そうだよね。僕たち、ココちゃんとかかなたんの前から入ってるメンバーから見ても
subtitles.english: Yeah, that's true. Even for members like us who joined before Coco-chan or Kanatan,

subtitles.original: やっぱりココちゃんはすごい伝説をね、残していったなっていう印象ありますよ。
subtitles.english: the impression remains that Coco-chan left behind an incredible legend.

subtitles.original: 4期生がホロライブに入って、ARKとかね、あさココとかも、毎日胸がドキドキするような時期だったし
subtitles.english: When Gen 4 joined Hololive, with things like ARK and AsaCoco, it was a time of daily excitement,

subtitles.original: 毎日の朝のライブ配信とか、他のホロメンの情報まとめてニュースでやるっていうのがすごく斬新で
subtitles.english: and her daily morning streams, summarizing news about other Hololive members, were so innovative,

subtitles.original: 天才だったなって今も思います。
subtitles.english: I still think she was a genius.

subtitles.original: 準備とかも大変な中、そういうことをやって、箱のためになったらいいとかをすごく考える人でしたね。
subtitles.english: Despite the difficult preparation, she did those things while thinking deeply about what would benefit the group.

subtitles.original: そんな風に仲が良かったからこそ、卒業をすることがもう完全に決まったっていう時は
subtitles.english: Because we were so close, when her graduation was finally and completely decided,

subtitles.original: やっぱり悲しい気持ちはもちろんありました。
subtitles.english: there was, of course, a feeling of sadness.

subtitles.original: その時に、ココの卒業を聞いた僕は、最後にやりたかったことがありました。
subtitles.english: At that time, upon hearing of Coco's graduation, there was one thing I wanted to do at the very end.

subtitles.original: それがこちら、次のページ。
subtitles.english: And that's this, on the next page.

subtitles.original: 4期生としてのオリジナル楽曲。
subtitles.english: An original song for Gen 4.

subtitles.original: せっかくなら5人のオリジナル曲欲しいよなって思ったんですよね。
subtitles.english: I thought, since we have the chance, I really want an original song for the five of us.

subtitles.original: そこで運営さんに「4期生の曲作りたい」と言うと、こう言われます。次。
subtitles.english: When I told management, "I want to make a song for Gen 4," this is what they said. Next.

subtitles.original: 「間に合いません」
subtitles.english: "It won't be in time."

subtitles.original: 時間がね。
subtitles.english: Because of the time...

subtitles.original: 曲の制作には時間かかりますし、卒業が決まった時には「今からの楽曲制作は間に合わない」とはっきり言われました。
subtitles.english: Song production takes time, and when the graduation was decided, I was told clearly that "starting production now won't be in time."

subtitles.original: これを言われた僕はこう思います。
subtitles.english: Having been told that, I thought...

subtitles.original: だったら自分で作っちゃおう。
subtitles.english: Then I'll just make it myself.

subtitles.original: すごい！ / よくそうなった。
subtitles.english: Amazing! / How did it come to that?

subtitles.original: 発注すると間に合わないなら
subtitles.english: If commissioning it won't be in time,
